title: Wellness and the Genito-Urinary System (Chapter 10) - The Handbook of Wellness Medicine
author: Karyn S Eilber
description: The Handbook of Wellness Medicine - August 2020

Eilber](/core/search?filters%5BauthorTerms%5D=Karyn%20S.%20Eilber&eventCode=SE-AU)and [Book contents](#toc-list-mobile) - The Handbook of Wellness Medicine - The Handbook of Wellness Medicine - Copyright page - Dedication - Contents - Contributors [Part I](/core/product/identifier/9781108650182%23PTN-BP-1/type/BOOK_PART)Approach to Wellness [Part II](/core/product/identifier/9781108650182%23PTN-BP-2/type/BOOK_PART)From Illness to Wellness by Organ Systems/Disorders [Chapter 6](/core/product/identifier/9781108650182%23CN-BP-6/type/BOOK_PART)The Concept of Wellness in Psychiatric and Substance-Use [Chapter 7](/core/product/identifier/9781108650182%23CN-BP-7/type/BOOK_PART)Neurological and Neurosurgical Disorders and Wellness [Chapter Wellness [Chapter 9](/core/product/identifier/9781108650182%23CN-BP-9/type/BOOK_PART)Gastrointestinal System Topics [Part IV](/core/product/identifier/9781108650182%23PTN-BP-4/type/BOOK_PART)Wellness Interventions [Part V](/core/product/identifier/9781108650182%23PTN-BP-5/type/BOOK_PART)Wellness through Optimization of Work, Love, and Play - Book part - Index [References](#references-list) Summary The focus of this chapter about the genito-urinary (GU) system is evidence-based information on how to support health and wellness of the urinary system in general, as well as during recovery from a urologic condition. It is widely accepted that diet, exercise, lifestyle, and behavior affect overall health by impacting organ systems. The impact of wellness medicine on the GU tract is less recognized and less robustly studied, but the principles remain important and impactful. This chapter will discuss: bladder health, including overactive bladder, urinary incontinence, and urinary infections; sexual health, including benign prostatic hyperplasia and prostate cancer; and kidney health, including kidney stones. - Type - Chapter - Information [The Handbook of Wellness Medicine](/core/books/the-handbook-of-wellness-medicine/2B33D8651A964A6B08B62BF31D734D93), pp. 98 - 115Publisher: Cambridge University PressPrint publication year: 2020 References [www.urologyhealth.org/patient-magazine/magazine-archives/2014/summer-2014/urinary-tract-infections-learn-how-to-spot-and-treat-them](http://www.urologyhealth.org/patient-magazine/magazine-archives/2014/summer-2014/urinary-tract-infections-learn-how-to-spot-and-treat-them)(accessed April 21, 2020).
